project.description: Job for modeling.mdt.papyrus project, dedicated to integration releases

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PROJECTID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: id of the project. This should always be modeling.mdt.papyrus

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: BUCKMINSTER_LOGLEVEL
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Logging level of information for buckminster

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CLEAN_TP
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Indicates if the target platform should be clean. true by default

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CLEAN_WORKSPACE
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Indicates if the workspace should be clean. true by default

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CLEAN_OUTPUT
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Indicates if the output folder should be clean. true by default

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: CLEAN_TOOLS
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Indicates if the tools should be cleaned

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_TYPE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
type of the release:
  • N: Nightly
  • M: Maintenance
  • R: release
  • S: Stable
  • I: Integration
Nightly builds won't be signed, contrary to other kind of builds.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_ALIAS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: the name of the release (0.8.0, 0.9.0M1, etc.); leave it blank for nightly and integration builds

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_TARGET
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
• test : Launch the build of the tool and then the JUnit tests on the result
  • site.p2 : Launch the build of the tool only - no tests
  • provision : Gets only the material required to launch the build
  • promote.sites : Unused

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: SITE_PACK200
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Pack the result jars in order to gain size and bandwidth for the eclipse download servers

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
SVN=/usr/local/bin/svn promoteDirName=/opt/public/modeling/mdt/papyrus/papyrusBuildPromoteDirNameI
echo "building in " $WORKSPACE
echo "cleaning previous results" rm -f ?20*.zip
echo "displaying java version" java -version #ls -al /shared/common/jdk-1.5.0-22.x86_64/jre/bin
: COMPACT_BUILD_ID="${BUILD_ID//[-_]}" COMPACT_BUILD_ID="${COMPACT_BUILD_ID:0:12}" FULL_BUILD_ID=${BUILD_TYPE}${COMPACT_BUILD_ID} echo $FULL_BUILD_ID > $promoteDirName :
rm -rf result/site.p2 mkdir -p result cp -a ${WORKSPACE}/buildroot/result/output/org.eclipse.papyrus.build.feature_*-eclipse.feature/site.p2 result

#publishing script# promoteSignal=/opt/public/modeling/mdt/papyrus/papyrusBuildPromoteSignalN promoteVersion=/opt/public/modeling/mdt/papyrus/papyrusBuildPromoteVersionN promoteDirName=/opt/public/modeling/mdt/papyrus/papyrusBuildPromoteDirNameN lastBuildLogFile=/opt/public/modeling/mdt/papyrus/lastBuildLogN
FULL_BUILD_ID=$(cat /opt/public/modeling/mdt/papyrus/papyrusBuildPromoteDirNameN)
if [ -n "$BUILD_ALIAS" ]; then zipName=Papyrus-Update-${BUILD_ALIAS}.zip else zipName=Papyrus-Update-${FULL_BUILD_ID}.zip fi
rm -rf ${WORKSPACE}/tmp mkdir -p "${WORKSPACE}/tmp/$FULL_BUILD_ID"
cd result/site.p2 zip -r $zipName * mv $zipName "${WORKSPACE}/tmp/$FULL_BUILD_ID"
# copy the psf generated file to the tmp dir cp ${WORKSPACE}/buildroot/result/*.psf "${WORKSPACE}/tmp/$FULL_BUILD_ID"
# copy tests results if [ -e ${WORKSPACE}/result/testresults ]; then mkdir ${WORKSPACE}/tmp/$FULL_BUILD_ID/testresults cp -r ${WORKSPACE}/result/testresults/ "${WORKSPACE}/tmp/$FULL_BUILD_ID" fi
# copy the build log to the result #wget --quiet --no-check-certificate https://hudson.eclipse.org/hudson/job/cbi-papyrus-integration/${BUILD_NUMBER}/consoleText -O "$lastBuildLogFile" wget --quiet --no-check-certificate ${HUDSON_URL}/job/${JOB_NAME}/${BUILD_NUMBER}/consoleText -O "$lastBuildLogFile"
cp "$lastBuildLogFile" "${WORKSPACE}/tmp/$FULL_BUILD_ID/buildlog.txt"
cd ${WORKSPACE}/tmp zip -r ${FULL_BUILD_ID}.zip * cd .. mv tmp/${FULL_BUILD_ID}.zip ${WORKSPACE}
echo ${FULL_BUILD_ID} > $promoteSignal echo $VERSION > $promoteVersion
